sections.title: Waste is in the eye of the beholder.
sections.body: Pelagic exists to reframe waste as a resource. What others discard, we turn into premium construction products that shape sustainable communities and build closed loop partnerships.

sections.title: Act locally, impact globally
sections.description: From our first installations in 2025 to more than 20 mod.factories worldwide by 2029, Pelagic is on track to upcycle thousands of tons of plastic waste into building products scaling local impact into a global circular system.

sections.title: Milan Design Week 2025
sections.description: In 2025 we exhibited at Milan Design Week. Alongside our physical exhibition we launched a digital companion—conceived as both exhibit and experiment, the platform invites visitors to reframe discarded plastics as a potential vast commodity; a story of hope and growth.

items.question: What makes Pelagic pavers different from traditional materials?
items.answer:
Pelagic pavers bricks represent a transformative approach to building materials, turning ocean plastic waste into high-performance structural pavers.

Key differentiators:

• Circular material: Each square meter of removes 30kg of plastic from the environment, creating value from waste.
• Performance standards: Engineered to meet or exceed traditional building material standards for durability and strength.
• Local production: Our portable mod.factories enable on-site manufacturing, reducing transportation and carbon footprint.
• Certified quality: Rigorous testing ensures compliance with building codes and industry certifications.

Unlike traditional bricks or concrete, our pavers create a closed-loop system where waste becomes a resource.

items.question: How can architects, developers, or councils partner with Pelagic?
items.answer:
Pelagic partners with architects, developers, and councils to turn local plastic waste into certified building materials.

We offer collaboration opportunities across three areas:

• Design integration: specify Pelagic pavers or systems in sustainable building projects.
• Circular manufacturing: establish on-site or regional micro-factories to process local waste streams.
• Policy and education: work with councils to pilot closed-loop infrastructure and community recycling programs.

items.question: What is the environmental impact of producing Pelagic pavers?
items.answer:
Pelagic pavers create a net positive environmental impact by transforming ocean plastic waste into durable building materials.

Environmental benefits:

• Waste diversion: Each square meter removes 30kg of plastic from marine environments.
• Carbon reduction: Our production process uses less energy than traditional brick manufacturing.
• Water conservation: Minimal water usage compared to conventional concrete production.
• Circular economy: Creates value from waste, reducing reliance on virgin materials.
• Local production: Portable mod.factories minimize transportation emissions.

Life cycle assessment shows Pelagic pavers have lower embodied carbon and environmental impact compared to traditional building materials.

items.question: How do the costs of Pelagic pavers compare to traditional building materials?
items.answer:
Pelagic offers competitive pricing with additional value through sustainability and performance.

Pricing considerations:

• Material costs: Comparable to premium traditional materials, with long-term value benefits.
• Installation: Similar installation processes reduce labor costs compared to specialized systems.
• Durability: Longer lifespan reduces replacement and maintenance costs over time.
• Sustainability credits: Potential LEED credits and environmental certifications may offset costs.
• Brand value: Demonstrate commitment to circular economy and environmental responsibility.

Contact our sales team for detailed pricing, volume discounts, and project-specific quotes.
